Viewing the Left Pane

The left pane of the main window shows the folder hierarchy. These folders have a one-to-many relationship with the contents of the upper pane because each folder can contain different types of items (for example, files and change requests).

On the left pane, you can perform the following operations:

Display information via icons

A folder icon precedes each folder name. Clicking this icon displays folder-associated information in the upper pane. The information displayed depends on the folder and the tab selected on the upper pane.

Expand and collapse branches

You can expand or collapse branches of the folder hierarchy. A plus sign identifies a collapsed branch. Clicking it expands the branch. A minus sign identifies an expanded branch. Clicking it collapses the branch. Alternatively, you can double-click folder names to expand or collapse branches of the folder tree.

Right-click for context menu

After selecting a folder from the folder hierarchy, right-click to display a context menu that presents the same choices as the Folder menu.

Drag and drop

To move a child folder, you can drag it from one parent folder to another. You can also drag items from the upper pane to the tree in the left pane for the current view or another view (if both are in the same server configuration). To move items from one folder or view to another, simply drag them from one location to the other.
